channel.title: Welcome to the Battlefield Portal Documentation on Portal Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to the Battlefield Portal Documentation on Portal Documentation

item.description: Stops the execution of a list of ACTIONS in a RULE.
Stops the execution of a list of ACTIONS in a RULE if the provided Bool is True. Otherwise, the execution continues with the remaining ACTIONS. Inputs Bool
Returns the unsigned value of the provided Number input. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the sum of two Number or two Vector values. Inputs Number | Vector Number | Vector Output Number | Vector
Returns a Bool value based on whether both of the provided inputs return True. Inputs Bool Bool Output Bool
Returns the angle (in degrees) between two provided Vector values. Inputs Vector Vector Output Number
Returns the difference between two angles (in degrees). Inputs Number (1st Angle) Number (2nd Angle) Output Number

Returns a copy of an Array with the provided value appended to the end. Note: It is not possible for an array to contain arrays. Attempting to append an array to an array will concatenate them instead. Inputs Array Any Type Output Array
Applies the effect of a medical gadget to a target Player. Inputs Player MedGadgetTypesItem
Returns the inverse cosine of a provided Number value in degrees. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the inverse cosine of a provided Number value in radians. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the inverse sine of a provided Number value in degrees. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the inverse sine of a provided Number value in radians. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the inverse tangent of a provided Number value in degrees. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the inverse tangent of a provided Number value in radians. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns a Bool value based on whether the provided Array contains the provided value. Inputs Array Any Type Output Bool
Returns a copy of the specified Array containing only values from a specified index range. Inputs Array Number (Start Index) Number (Count) Output Array
Returns the backward directional Vector of (0, 0, 1). Output Vector

A Bool is fancy game developer talk for a True or False value. This type is used to define or identify the state of a variety of things. Is a player currently prone? Is the player using a specific soldier? Can players not score points because of some custom condition?
Breaks and exits the execution of a looping block, such as While or LoopVariable.
Sets the capturing time for target CapturePoint to the provided Number. Inputs CapturePoint Number
Sets the neutralization time for target CapturePoint to the provided Number. Inputs CapturePoint Number
Returns a CapturePointsItem from the collection of all possible capture points. Output CapturePointsItem
Clears all custom messages for a provided Player or TeamId. If no Player or TeamId is provided, it will clear all custom messages for everyone. Inputs Player | TeamId (Group) Optional

Clears text from the provided CustomMessageSlotsItem for the provided Player or TeamId. If no Player or TeamId is given, it clears all players text at that CustomMessageSlotsItem. Inputs CustomMessageSlotsItem Player | TeamId (Group) Optional

Returns the closest alive Player to a provided position. Can be filtered using a TeamId. Note: If no players are alive when this block is called, the returned Player will be invalid. Inputs Vector (Position) TeamId Optional Output Player
Returns a Bool indicating if the target CapturePoint has the same designation as the provided CapturePointsItem. Inputs CapturePoint CapturePointsItem Output Bool

Returns a Bool indicating if the target Vehicle has the same name as the provided VehiclesItem or if it is the same type as the provided VehicleTypesItem. Inputs Vehicle VehiclesItem | VehicleTypesItem Output Bool
Evaluates the condition to run a RULE or SUBROUTINE block based on the Bool input. Inputs Bool
Forces the execution of a looping block (such as While or LoopVariable) to the start of the next iteration of that block.
The start of a conditional control block whose ACTIONS will execute if its condition is True. Inputs Bool
Returns the cosine value of a specified angle in degrees. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the cosine value of a specified angle in radians. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the Number of elements in the specified Array. Inputs Array Output Number
Returns a Vector composed of three provided ‘X’ (left), ‘Y’ (up), and ‘Z’ (forward) values. Inputs Number (X Value) Number (Y Value) Number (Z Value) Output Vector
Returns the cross product between two Vector values. If the two Vector inputs are parallel, the result will be zero. Inputs Vector Vector Output Vector
Returns a reference to the current Array element being evaluated. Only used for FilteredArray, MappedArray, SortedArray, IsTrueForAll, and IsTrueForAny. Output Any Type
Returns a CustomMessageSlotsItem which can be used with DisplayCustomMessage and ClearCustomMessage to display information on screen to players. Output CustomMessageSlotsItem
Returns a DamageTypesItem from the collection of all possible damage types. Output DamageTypesItem
Damages the target Vehicle by the provided Number amount. Inputs Vehicle Number
Deals a provided amount of damage to a target Player by a another Player. Inputs Player (Target) Number Player (Giver) Optional
Returns a DeathTypesItem from the collection of all possible death types. Output DeathTypesItem
Force spawns all players in the deploy screen.
Deploys a target Player onto the battlefield from the deploy screen. Inputs Player
Destroys the target Vehicle. Inputs Vehicle
Returns a directional Vector from the provided horizontal (yaw) and vertical (pitch) angles (in degrees). Inputs Number (Horizontal) Number (Vertical) Output Vector
Returns the direction, or normalized Vector, from a starting position and ending position. Inputs Vector (Starting Position) Vector (Ending Position) Output Vector

Display a Message on-screen in the upper right corner. Using the CustomMessageSlotsItem, this Message can be displayed on multiple lines. It will stay up for the length of the provided duration, or stay up indefinitely if a negative Number is provided. It will be displayed to everyone unless a specific Player or TeamId is provided. Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.

Displays a Message on the top center of the screen for 6 seconds. If no target is provided, the Message will display to everyone. Note: This will only appear to players that are deployed on the map. It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans. Inputs Message Player | TeamId Optional

Displays a Message on the world log above the minimap for 6 seconds. If no target is provided, it will display the Message to everyone. Note: This will only appear to players that are deployed on the map. It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans. Inputs Message Player | TeamId Optional

Displays a notification-type Message on the top-right of the screen for 6 seconds. If no target is provided, it will display the Message to everyone. Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans. Inputs Message Player | TeamId Optional
Returns the distance between a starting position and ending position. Inputs Vector (Starting Position) Vector (Ending Position) Output Number
Returns the ratio between two Number values or a Vector and Number value. A Vector divided by a Number will yield a scaled Vector. Inputs Number | Vector Number Output Number | Vector
Returns the dot product between two Vector values. If the two values are orthogonal to each other, the result will be zero. Inputs Vector Vector Output Number
Returns the downward directional Vector of (0, -1, 0). Output Vector
The start of a block of ACTIONS that will execute if all previous If and ElseIf conditions are False.
The start of a block of ACTIONS that will run if its condition is True and all previous If or ElseIf conditions are False. Inputs Bool
Returns an initialized empty Array. Output Array
Enables or disables all keyboard and mouse inputs - such as movement, firing, and turning - for a target Player. Inputs Player Bool
Enables or disables spawning from the deploy screen for all players. Inputs Bool
Enables or disables deploying on provided CapturePoint for the team that owns it. Inputs CapturePoint Bool
Enables or disables capturing a provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Bool

Enables or disables default gamemode scoring logic, which refers to the base gamemode’s scoring rules. For instance, disabling this rule will remove ticket bleed from Conquest or add one point for kills in Free-for-All. Disable this if you want to implement your own custom scoring logic. Inputs Bool

Enables or disables the gamemode’s default win condition logic. The win condition is checked when the time limit is reached or when a team or player reaches the target score. Disable this if you want to trigger your own win condition. Inputs Bool
Enables or disables the provided CapturePoint or MCOM. Note: MCOMs are only available on TDM, VTDM, and Custom Conquest layouts. Inputs CapturePoint | MCOM Bool
Enables or disables a headquarters specified by the provided TeamId and Number index. Note: The index begins counting at 0. Inputs TeamId Number (Index) Bool
Enables or disables a specified InputRestrictionsItem on a target Player. Inputs Player InputRestrictionsItem Bool
Enables or disables the ability for a target Player to deploy. Inputs Player Bool
Enables or disables ticket bleed acceleration for both teams. Ticket bleed acceleration is on by default and only comes into effect if one team owns all sectors for about 60 seconds. Inputs Bool
Enables or disables the gamemode voice-over (VO) text and audio messaging, such as announcements about sector majority and capture points. Note: This function is enabled by default. Inputs Bool
Enables or disables the image for a provided WorldIconsItem. Inputs WorldIconsItem Bool
Enables or disables the text for a provided WorldIconsItem. Note: There is no default text, and will need to be set before or after this property is enabled to appear. Inputs WorldIconsItem Bool
Ends the current gamemode and designates the provided Player or TeamId as the winner. The gamemode ends in draw if TeamId is set to 0. Inputs TeamId | Player
Returns a Bool indicating if two values are equal to each other. Inputs Any Type Any Type Output Bool
Returns the CapturePoint payload from the RULE EVENT context. Output CapturePoint
Returns the DamageType of the victim from the OnPlayerDamaged EVENT context. Output DamageType
Returns the DeathType of the victim from the OnPlayerDied or OnPlayerEarnedKill EVENT context. Output DeathType
Returns a MCOM payload from the RULE EVENT context. Output MCOM
Returns the 2nd Player payload from the RULE EVENT context. Output Player
Returns the 1st Player payload from the RULE EVENT context. Output Player
Returns the Number seat index payload of a Vehicle from the RULE EVENT context. Output Number
Returns the TeamId payload from the Ongoing Team EVENT context. Output TeamId
Returns the Vehicle payload from the RULE EVENT context. Output Vehicle
Returns the HardwareId of the weapon used to kill the victim from the OnPlayerDied or OnPlayerEarnedKill EVENT context. Output HardwareId
Returns a FactionsItem from the collection of all available factions. Output FactionsItem

Returns the farthest alive Player from a provided position. Can be filtered using a TeamId. Note: If no players are alive when this block is called, the returned Player will be invalid. Inputs Vector (Position) TeamId Optional Output Player

Returns a filtered version of the specified Array based on the condition provided. This block cycles through the entire array. You can utilize the CurrentArrayElement block to represent the element in the Array for each iteration. For an Array like GetPlayers, CurrentArrayElement would represent each Player in that Array. You can then build your filter condition based on a property of that Player (like score, or some custom player Variable value).
Returns the first value of the specified Array. Inputs Array Output Any Type
Forces all players to exit the target Vehicle. Inputs Vehicle
Puts the target Player into the mandown state (unless mandown is disabled). Inputs Player
Forces the specified Player to exit the target Vehicle. Inputs Player Vehicle

Forces the specified Player into the target Vehicle at the provided seat Number. Note: If the provided index is -1, that Player will be forced into the first available seat. Inputs Player Vehicle Number
Revives a target Player that is in the mandown state. Inputs Player
Forces the target Player to switch to the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem
Returns the forward directional Vector of (0, 0, -1). Output Vector
Returns an Array of all capture points within a game. Output Array
Returns an Array of all MCOMs within a game. Output Array
Returns a Array of all players inside a provided Vehicle Inputs Vehicle Output Array
Returns an Array of all vehicles within a game. Output Array
Returns the in-world position of the provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Output Vector
Returns a Number from zero to one corresponding to the capture progress of the provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Output Number
Returns the current owner TeamId corresponding to the provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Output TeamId
Returns the current gamemode score of the provided Player or TeamId. Inputs Player | TeamId Output Number
Returns the gamemode target score needed for victory. Output Number
Returns the total elapsed time of the current gamemode. Output Number
Returns the time limit set for the gamemode (in seconds). Output Number
Returns the amount of time left (seconds) in the current gamemode. Output Number
Returns the target Player loaded ammo of the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Output Number
Returns the target Player magazine ammo of the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Output Number
Returns the value of the target MCOM state. Inputs MCOM MCOMStateBoolItem Output Bool
Returns the CapturePoint or MCOM corresponding to the provided CapturePointsItem or MCOMsItem respectively. Inputs CapturePointsItem Output CapturePoint
Returns the TeamId of the team currently capturing the provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Output TeamId
Returns the total amount of deaths for the target Player. Inputs Player Output Number

Returns the Player currently occupying the provided seat index Number of the provided Vehicle. Note: If no players are in the vehicle seat when this block is called, the returned Player will be invalid. Inputs Vehicle Number Output Player
Returns the total amount of kills for the target Player. Inputs Player Output Number
Returns an Array of all players within a game. Output Array
Returns a Array of all players within the boundaries of a provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Output Array
Returns the value of the target Player state. Inputs Player PlayerStateBoolItem | PlayerStateNumberItem | PlayerStateVectorItem Output Bool | Number | Vector
Returns the seat index Number for the target Player if they are in a vehicle, otherwise returns -1. Inputs Player Output Number
Returns the previous owner TeamId corresponding to the provided CapturePoint. Inputs CapturePoint Output TeamId
Returns the remaining fuse time (in seconds) on the provided MCOM. Inputs MCOM Output Number
Returns the Number of seats in a Vehicle. Inputs Vehicle Output Number
Returns the value of the argument that is passed into the SUBROUTINE. The list of available parameters will populate once this block is placed inside the SUBROUTINE. Output Any Type
Returns the TeamId value of the specified Player OR the corresponding TeamId of the provided Number. Inputs Player | Number Output TeamId
Returns the value of a Variable. Inputs Variable Output Any Type
Returns the Vehicle used by a Player. Inputs Player Output Vehicle
Returns the value of the target Vehicle state. Inputs Vehicle VehicleStateVectorItem Output Vector
Returns the TeamId of the provided Vehicle. Note: A Vehicle that is not occupied will have a neutral TeamId. Inputs Vehicle Output TeamId
Returns the ‘X’ component of a provided Vector. Inputs Vector Output Number
Returns the ‘Y’ component of a provided Vector. Inputs Vector Output Number
Returns the ‘Z’ component of a provided Vector. Inputs Vector Output Number
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is greater than the 2nd provided value. Inputs Number Number Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is greater than the 2nd provided value. Inputs Number Number Output Bool

Returns a Bool indicating if the provided Player has the specified ability. Inputs Player InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem | InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem | InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem | InventoryOpenGadgetsItem | InventoryClassGadgetsItem | InventoryThrowablesItem | InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem Output Bool

Instantly adds a given amount of health to the target Player applied by a healer Player. Note: When healing a player with a max health multiplier not equal to 1, the amount of health they receive will scale with their max health multiplier value. Inputs Player (Target) Number Player (Healer) Optional
A special block which evaluates conditions to control the flow of ACTIONS in the If, Else If, and Else branches.

Returns the 1st provided value if the condition is True, otherwise, returns the 2nd provided value. Inputs Bool Any Type (Output Value if the Condition is True) Any Type (Output Value if the Condition is False) Output Any Type
Returns the index of an Array value. Inputs Array Any Type Output Number
Returns a InputRestrictionsItem from the collection of all inputs which can be restricted with EnableInputRestriction. Output InputRestrictionsItem
Returns an InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem from the collection of all character specialties. Output InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem
Returns an InventoryClassGadgetsItem from the collection of all class gadgets. Output InventoryClassGadgetsItem
Returns an InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem from the collection of all melee weapons. Output InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem
Returns an InventoryOpenGadgetsItem from the collection of all open gadgets. Output InventoryOpenGadgetsItem
Returns an InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem from the collection of all primary weapons. Output InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem
Returns an InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem from the collection of all secondary weapons. Output InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem
Returns a InventoryThrowablesItem from the collection of all throwables. Output InventoryThrowablesItem
Returns True if the provided MapsItem is the name of the current map. Inputs MapsItem Output Bool
Returns True if the provided TeamId is using soldiers from the specified FactionsItem. Inputs TeamId FactionsItem Output Bool
Returns True whether or not the active inventory slot of the target Player is the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Output Bool

Returns a Bool indicating if the given HardwareId is equivalent to the provided ability. Inputs HardwareId InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem | InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem | InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem | InventoryOpenGadgetsItem | InventoryClassGadgetsItem | InventoryThrowablesItem | InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the target Player is a specified PlayerSoldiersItem. Inputs Player PlayerSoldiersItem
Returns True if the provided Player is valid. Inputs Player Output Bool
Returns True if the provided condition is True for every element in the provided Array. Inputs Array Bool Output Bool
Returns True if the provided condition is True for at least one element in the provided Array. Inputs Array Bool Output Bool
Returns True if the provided value is equal to the specified TypesItem. Inputs Any Type TypesItem Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the target Vehicle is a occupied by a player. Inputs Vehicle Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the target seat index Number of target Vehicle is a occupied by a player. Inputs Vehicle Number Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the victim was damaged by the provided DamageType. Inputs DamageType DamageTypesItem Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the victim died by the provided DeathType. Inputs DeathType DeathTypesItem Output Bool
Kills a target Player (skips the Mandown state). Inputs Player
Returns the value at the end of the specified Array. Inputs Array Output Any Type
Returns the leftward directional Vector of (-1, 0, 0). Output Vector
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is less than the 2nd provided value. Inputs Number Number Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if the 1st provided value is less than or equal to the 2nd provided value. Inputs Number Number Output Bool
Converts the provided local Player position to the corresponding position in the world space. Inputs Vector (Local Position) Player Output Vector (World Position)
Converts the provided local Player vector to the corresponding vector in the world space. Inputs Vector (Local Vector) Player Output Vector (World Vector)
Returns a LocationalSoundsItem from the collection of locational sounds. Output LocationalSoundsItem

The start of a series of ACTIONS that will execute in a loop, modifying the control variable on each iteration. If the control Variable reaches or passes the range end value, the loop exits, and execution continues through the remaining ACTIONS in the RULE. Inputs Variable Number (Start) Number (End) Number (Interval)

Returns a copy of the provided Array with the values evaluated using the mapped expression provided. The following example utilizes the GetPlayers Array with GetGameModeScore and CurrentArrayElement to return an Array of Player scores. Inputs Array Any Type (Mapped Expression) Output Array
Returns a MapsItem from the collection of all maps. Output MapsItem
Returns the greater of the two Number values provided. Inputs Number Number Output Number
Returns a MCOMsItem from the collection of all possible MCOMs. Output MCOMsItem
Returns the MCOMStateBoolItem of the selected Bool-based MCOM property. Output Bool
Returns a MedGadgetTypesItem from the collection of medical gadget types which can be used with the ApplyMedGadget. Output MedGadgetTypesItem

Returns a constructed Message object which can be used with DisplayGameModeMessage, DisplayNotificationMessage, DisplayHighlightedWorldLogMessage, and DisplayCustomMessage. The Message object is created by providing a Number, Player, or format String (which can take up to 3 format items). A format String is a String that contains {} (called braces) within them, which can be substituted for parameters. For example, the String - {} gained {} points! - can be given a Player and Number parameter and could output as John gained 2 points!

Anything you want to work within your custom gamemode must be placed inside this block. You can put blocks you’re working on outside of this block but they will not be executed. You can utilize the space outside the MOD block as a brainstorming area.
Returns the remainder of the 1st provided value divided by the 2nd provided value. Inputs Number Number Output Number
Returns the product of two Number values or the product of a Vector and Number value. Inputs Number | Vector Number Output Number | Vector
Returns a unit-length normalization of a Vector. Inputs Vector Output Vector
Return a Bool of the opposite value of the Bool input. Inputs Bool Output Bool
Returns a Bool indicating if two values are not equal to each other. Inputs Any Type Any Type Output Bool
You can enter any numerical value you want here. 1, 2, 3.14, -10.2 Use this block in combination with math blocks to do all sorts of fun mathematical equations.
Returns a Bool based on whether either of the two inputs are True. Inputs Bool Bool Output Bool
Pauses or unpauses the gamemode timer based on the provided Bool input. Inputs Bool
Returns a PlayerInventorySlotsItem from the collection of all available player inventory slots. Output PlayerInventorySlotsItem
Returns a PlayerSoldiersItem from a list of all soldiers. Output PlayerSoldiersItem
Returns the PlayerStateBoolItem of the selected Bool-based player property. Output PlayerStateBoolItem
Returns the PlayerStateNumberItem of the selected Number-based player property. Output PlayerStateNumberItem
Returns the PlayerStateVectorItem of the selected Vector-based player property. Output PlayerStateVectorItem
Returns the 1st provided value raised to the power of the 2nd provided value. Inputs Number (Base) Number (Exponent) Output Number
Returns a copy of the specified Array with the values in a random order. Inputs Array Output Array
Returns a random Number between a specified minimum and maximum value (inclusive). Inputs Number (Minimum) Number (Maximum) Output Number
Returns a random value from the specified Array. Inputs Array Output Any Type
Returns a copy of the specified Array with the provided value removed. Inputs Array Any Type Output Array

Removes a specified inventory item from a target Player if that item is equipped. Inputs Player InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem | InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem | InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem | InventoryOpenGadgetsItem | InventoryClassGadgetsItem | InventoryThrowablesItem
Removes the inventory from a target Player at the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem

Repairs target Vehicle by the provided Number amount. Note: When repairing a vehicle with a max health multiplier not equal to 1, the amount of health they receive will scale with their max health multiplier value. Inputs Vehicle Number

Gives a target Player a new inventory item. Inputs Player InventoryPrimaryWeaponsItem | InventorySecondaryWeaponsItem | InventoryCharacterSpecialtiesItem | InventoryOpenGadgetsItem | InventoryClassGadgetsItem | InventoryThrowablesItem | InventoryMeleeWeaponsItem
Resets the gamemode time to its starting value.
Resupplies the target Player using a provided ResupplyTypesItem. Inputs Player ResupplyTypesItem
Returns a ResupplyTypesItem from the collection of resupply types which can be used with Resupply. Output ResupplyTypesItem
Returns the rightward directional Vector of (1, 0, 0). Output Vector

Returns a whole Number rounded from the input value. The value rounds up if the decimal of the Number is greater than or equal to 0.5, and rounds down if it is less than 0.5. Inputs Number Output Number

RULE blocks are triggered from an in-game EVENT. When an EVENT triggers, this block will check if its CONDITION has been met and then execute all of the ACTIONS. Types of RULE Blocks Events Ongoing Ongoing EVENT types continually check if its CONDITION has become True. If so, the ACTIONS will be executed once. In order for the EVENT to execute again, the CONDITION must become False before becoming True again.
Displays a provided Message as an error in the Admin menu. Inputs Message
Sets the capture time multiplier for target CapturePoint to the provided Number. Inputs CapturePoint Number
Sets the gamemode score of the provided Player or TeamId. Inputs Player | TeamId Number
Sets the gamemode target score used to determine victory. Inputs Number
Sets the duration of the game in seconds. Inputs Number
Sets the target Player loaded ammo for the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Number
Sets the target Player magazine ammo for the provided PlayerInventorySlotsItem. Inputs Player PlayerInventorySlotsItem Number
Sets the fuse time (in seconds) for target MCOM to the provided Number Inputs MCOM Number
Sets the neutralization time multiplier for target CapturePoint to the provided Number. Inputs CapturePoint Number
Claims the provided CapturePoint for the specified TeamId. Inputs CapturePoint TeamId
Sets the max health of a target Player from 0 to 1000. Note: The value will be multiplied by the max health multiplier of the that target. Inputs Player Number

Sets a target Player soldier using a provided PlayerSoldiersItem. The soldier selected should be one that is available from that player team’s faction, otherwise, the soldier will not be set. (ex. if a team’s faction is Bad Company 2 US, that player may only select Bad Company 2 US soldiers). Inputs Player PlayerSoldiersItem
Overrides the time to redeploy for a target Player. Note: The redeploy time must be set to a value between 0 and 60 seconds. Inputs Player Number
Sets the target Player team using the provided TeamId. This will force the Player back to the deploy screen. Note: this block is not supported in Free-For-All. Inputs Player TeamId
Sets the value of a Variable. Inputs Variable Any Type

Finds or initializes an Array on a provided Variable, and stores a provided value in that Array at the specified index. Note: The first value in the array starts at an index of 0. Inputs Variable Number (Index) Any Type (Value)

Multiplies the maximum health of target Vehicle by the provided Number greater than 0 and less than or equal to 4. Note: The health of a Vehicle is displayed in-game as a percentage. Inputs Vehicle Number
Sets the image property of a WorldIconsItem to the selected WorldIconImagesItem. Inputs WorldIconsItem WorldIconImagesItem
Sets the owner TeamId of the provided WorldIconsItem. Inputs WorldIconsItem TeamId
Sets the in-world position of a provided WorldIconsItem. Inputs WorldIconsItem Vector
Sets the text property for a provided WorldIconsItem. Inputs WorldIconsItem Message
Returns the sine value of a specified angle in degrees. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the sine value of a specified angle in radians. Inputs Number Output Number
Skips a provided number of ACTIONS following this block within this RULE. Inputs Number
Skips a provided number of ACTIONS following this block within this RULE if the condition evaluates to True. If it does not, execution continues with the remaining ACTIONS. Inputs Number Bool
Sets the target Player to skip the mandown state and go directly to the deploy screen when killed. Note: By default, SkipMandown is disabled. Inputs Player Bool

Returns a sorted version of the specified Array given a Number value to sort by (ascending). CurrentArrayElement can be utilized to represent each value in the Array. In the following example, CurrentArrayElement is used to represent each Player in GetPlayers. GetGameModeScore is used with CurrentArrayElement to return the score, used as a rank, to sort the Array in ascending order. Inputs Array Number (Rank) Output Array
Returns a SoundsItem from the collection of sounds. Output SoundsItem
Spots a target Player for all players for a specified duration of time (in seconds). Inputs Player Number (Duration)
Spots a target Player only for a specified Player for a provided duration of time (in seconds). Inputs Player (Target) Player (Spotter) Number (Duration)
Returns the square root of a provided Number value. Inputs Number Output Number
Stops an in-progress tracking of a Variable from the TrackVariableOverTime or TrackVariableAtRate blocks, leaving it at its current value. Inputs Variable

You can use this block to utilize text within your mod. Team 2s Flag has been Captured! A player has become the Juggernaut. Beware! Phase 3 of your really cool custom mod has started! Note: It’s your responsibility to ensure a safe and fair experience for others, violating the EA User Agreement by using offensive or inappropriate text may result in account bans.

SUBROUTINE blocks are special blocks that are similar to RULE blocks, but do not have a designated EVENT. A SUBROUTINE block’s ACTIONS will be executed when called from the RULE block. Like RULE blocks, SUBROUTINE blocks can have a CONDITION to determine whether or not the ACTIONS inside should execute. An important note is payload values, including EventPlayer, EventOtherPlayer, and EventTeam, use the context of the RULE block in which the SUBROUTINE instance block is placed in.
Calls a SUBROUTINE block of the same name.
Returns the difference between two Number values or two Vector values. Inputs Number | Vector Number | Vector Output Number | Vector
Returns the tangent value of a specified angle in degrees. Inputs Number Output Number
Returns the tangent value of a specified angle in radians. Inputs Number Output Number
Teleports a target to a provided valid position facing a specified angle (in radians). Inputs Player | Vehicle Vector (Position) Number (Yaw Rotation)

Gradually modifies the value of a Variable at a specified rate (value/second) until it reaches the provided limit. Note: If the limit is changed later, the Variable will continue to be updated from its previous value. To spot modifying the Variable, use StopTrackingVariable. Inputs Variable Number (Limit) Number (Rate)

Gradually modifies the value of a Variable over time (in seconds). The variable’s value will reach the limit at the end of the interval. Note: If the limit is changed later, the Variable will continue to be updated from its previous value. To spot modifying the Variable, use StopTrackingVariable. Inputs Variable Number (Limit) Number (Interval)
Plays a provided SoundsItem or VoiceOversItem to a provided TeamId. Inputs SoundsItem | VoiceOversItem TeamId
Plays a selected LocationalSoundsItem at a specified position. Inputs LocationalSoundsItem Vector
Returns a TypesItem from the collection of all object types. Output TypesItem
Undeploys all players that are alive on the battlefield back to the deploy screen.
Undeploys a target Player that is alive on the battlefield back to the deploy screen. Inputs Player
Unspots a target Player for all players. Inputs Player
Returns the upward directional Vector of (0, 1, 0). Output Vector
Returns the value found at a provided index of an Array. Inputs Array Number Output Any Type

This block is used to reference a Variable instance. The Variable can be selected by setting the scope - Global , Player, or Team - in the first dropdown, and then selecting the Variable name in the second dropdown. Variable instances can be created or deleted by clicking on the Variables tab, and clicking on Manage Variables.
Returns the displacement Vector from a starting position to an ending position. Inputs Vector (Starting Position) Vector (Ending Position) Output Vector
Returns a VehiclesItem from the Vehicle collection. Output VehiclesItem
Returns the VehicleStateVectorItem of the selected Vector-based vehicle property. Output VehicleStateVectorItem
Returns a VehicleTypesItem from the collection of all Vehicle types. Output VehicleTypesItem
Returns a VoiceOversItem from the collection of voice overs. Output VoiceOversItem
Pauses the execution of ACTIONS in a RULE for a provided Number of seconds. Inputs Number
Pauses the execution of ACTIONS in a RULE for a provided Number of seconds or if the provided condition evaluates to True during that interval. Inputs Number Bool
A block of ACTIONS that will execute in a loop as long as the provided condition is True. Note: You must utilize a Wait block at the beginning or the end of the iteration. Inputs Bool
Returns a WorldIconImagesItem from the collection of world icon images. Output WorldIconImagesItem
Returns a WorldIconsItem from the collection of world icon entities. Output WorldIconsItem
Converts the provided world position to the corresponding position in local Player space. Inputs Vector (World Position) Player Output Vector (Local Position)
Converts the provided world vector to the corresponding vector in local Player space. Inputs Vector (World Vector) Player Output Vector (Local Vector)
Returns True if the provided Bool inputs return different values. Inputs Bool Bool Output Bool

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: This page tells you about how to get started with the Battlefield Portal game mode.

item.title: Make a Custom Gun Game
item.description: Work in progress This tutorial will show you how to make a custom Gun Game using the Portal Mod Builder.
